@graph.name: Brookies (From Scratch) - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: Brookies are the ultimate dessert! A fudgy chocolate brownie sits atop a gooey chocolate chip cookie - both made from scratch.

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can double this brookie recipe and bake it in a 9x13" pan if you want to make a dessert to feed a large crowd. Remember, these are very rich so a little bit goes a long way.

@graph.name: How do you know when brookies are done?

acceptedAnswer.text: This can be tricky and I've found it's fairly easy to over or under-bake these bars. You know they're done when the brownie top is set and shiny and the bars just barely jiggle when the pan is lightly moved from side to side.

@graph.name: Best Brookies Recipe (from scratch)
@graph.description: Brookies are the ultimate dessert for the indecisive eater. . A fudgy chocolate brownie layer sits atop a gooey chocolate chip cookie layer - both made from scratch. There's no need to choose between a cookie or a brownie, because you get both in this brookie recipe!

video.name: Best Brookies Recipe (From Scratch)
video.description: Brookies are the ultimate dessert for the indecisive eater. . A fudgy chocolate brownie layer sits atop a gooey chocolate chip cookie layer - both made from scratch. There's no need to choose between a cookie or a brownie, because you get both in this brookie recipe!

recipeInstructions.text: Line an 8x8” or 9x9” square baking pan with parchment paper and lightly grease. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Line an 8x8” or 9x9” square baking pan with parchment paper and lightly grease. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: In a small bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: In a small bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: In the bowl of a standing mixer (or in a large bowl with a handheld mixer), cream together butter, light brown sugar and granulated sugar until well combined.
itemListElement.name: In the bowl of a standing mixer (or in a large bowl with a handheld mixer), cream together butter, light brown sugar and granulated sugar until well combined.

itemListElement.text: Add egg and vanilla to the butter/sugar mixture and beat until smooth.
itemListElement.name: Add egg and vanilla to the butter/sugar mixture and beat until smooth.

itemListElement.text: Add dry ingredients and beat until all the ingredients are thoroughly combined.
itemListElement.name: Add dry ingredients and beat until all the ingredients are thoroughly combined.

itemListElement.text: Add chocolate chips and mix until evenly distributed.
itemListElement.name: Add chocolate chips and mix until evenly distributed.

itemListElement.text: Press the cookie dough into the bottom of the prepared baking pan.
itemListElement.name: Press the cookie dough into the bottom of the prepared baking pan.

itemListElement.text: Mix flour, cocoa powder and sea salt together in a small bowl; set aside.
itemListElement.name: Mix flour, cocoa powder and sea salt together in a small bowl; set aside.

itemListElement.text: Melt chocolate and butter together in a microwave safe bowl, or on the stovetop over low heat. Stir until smooth and glossy. Set aside to cool slightly.
itemListElement.name: Melt chocolate and butter together in a microwave safe bowl, or on the stovetop over low heat. Stir until smooth and glossy. Set aside to cool slightly.

itemListElement.text: In the bowl of a standing mixer (or in a large bowl with a handheld mixer), beat eggs for 30-60 seconds, or until pale and thick.
itemListElement.name: In the bowl of a standing mixer (or in a large bowl with a handheld mixer), beat eggs for 30-60 seconds, or until pale and thick.

itemListElement.text: Add sugar and beat for an additional 30-60 seconds, until sugar is dissolved.
itemListElement.name: Add sugar and beat for an additional 30-60 seconds, until sugar is dissolved.

itemListElement.text: Add melted chocolate/butter mixture and vanilla and stir on low speed until batter is smooth.
itemListElement.name: Add melted chocolate/butter mixture and vanilla and stir on low speed until batter is smooth.

itemListElement.text: Add dry ingredients, mix on low speed until just incorporated and there are no lumps.
itemListElement.name: Add dry ingredients, mix on low speed until just incorporated and there are no lumps.

itemListElement.text: Pour the brownie batter into the prepared pan and spread it evenly over the chocolate chip cookie layer.
itemListElement.name: Pour the brownie batter into the prepared pan and spread it evenly over the chocolate chip cookie layer.

itemListElement.text: Bake on the lower rack in the preheated oven until the top is set and the brownies are only very slightly “jiggly”, 25-35 minutes.**
itemListElement.name: Bake on the lower rack in the preheated oven until the top is set and the brownies are only very slightly “jiggly”, 25-35 minutes.**

itemListElement.text: Place pan on a wire cooling rack to cool completely.
itemListElement.name: Place pan on a wire cooling rack to cool completely.
